stance_1: I cook for my son and include meat
stance_2: I have meat every evening with dinner
justification: The interviewee says they have meat every evening with dinner and also cooks for their son, who eats what they make. The behavior of cooking for the son supports the habit of daily meat consumption.

stance_1: I cook for my son and include meat
stance_2: I was taught dinner should include meat
justification: The motivation for including meat when cooking for the son is implicitly supported by the belief that dinner should include meat, which the interviewee was taught.

stance_1: I have meat every evening with dinner
stance_2: I was taught dinner should include meat
justification: The interviewee explicitly connects their daily meat-eating habit to being taught that dinner should include meat.
